website_summaries.verdict: A finger-safe, no-touch set of 2 mouse traps that is economical and easy to place. Experienced manufacturer understands pest control problems.
pros: Red label confirms proper set-up by hand or foot (not fingers)
Small enough to fit in remote locations, away from kids and pets
cons: First snap is not always lethal
Use caution when resetting trap or replacing bait

customer_reviews.title: Better than Tomcat Press and Set and WAY BETTER than Victor 1405
customer_reviews.text: I bought all three and tested them side by side over a two week period. These and the Tomcats performed equally well, regularly capturing mice and killing them instantly. The spring mechanism is very strong but it is very easy to set. The sharp "teeth" on the kill bar are better than the Tomcat but very close call. The Victor units were USELESS. After the first three days I did not bother using them. The spring is very weak and the kill bar has no teeth. I thought I could hear the mice laughing at me after the first night.
customer_reviews.author: santaferetiree

customer_reviews.title: Insane!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 4 of these and set them up in my kitchen before bed. They were super easy to set, and I smooshed some extra sharp cheddar in the bait holes. Literally as soon as I turned the lights off, went into my room, and set up my diffuser - a trap went off. I checked and found the first victim... It's now after 1am, and we are up to three! These traps are impressive and really work. These are worth every penny. The best part is that in the morning I can remove the dead mice without touching, and set these all back up for another successful night of exterminating.
customer_reviews.author: exxxotic

customer_reviews.title: Many issues
customer_reviews.text: They do trap mice. Received a package of two on Friday. One of the two would not stay triggered. So now I baited the one remaining trap with peanut butter and placed in my garage. Bingo! And easy to dispose of dead rodent and bait again. After one more successful trap, it did not kill the next three. The trapped mice dragged the trap a considerable distance and I was left with live mice to deal with. So it seems great st catching our very small mice. But is inhumane and one was a waste from the get go. Disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff P.

customer_reviews.title: They do not work
customer_reviews.text: Tired to use this product to catch mice in garage. Used dog food and peanut butter. Nothing works. Mice stole the dog food. Ate the peanut butter. Used zapper in same garage and caught mice. This product does not work. The spring is not sensitive enough for it to snap on field mice.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Jawz did not catch anything.
customer_reviews.text: We have had to get rid of 5 mice in less than 2 weeks due to the field next to us being cut. Not one mouse was caught on this trap. The mice basically took the bait and kept moving. It took my hubby purchasing a 6 pack of sticky traps from a discount store ( 6 for $1 might I add) to get rid of these pests. I'm glad I didn't purchase the bigger pack of Jawz traps like I started because I would have been very, very disappointed and wanted my money back.
customer_reviews.author: S. Wilder

customer_reviews.title: Great Mouse Trap
customer_reviews.text: We always use these around fall and winter time since its prime time for mouse infestation. We use to buy these from Menards and they are about .50 to $1 more than these 2pck. I like these because they are easy to use and I can reuse them for about 10 times before they start get loose and not holding the clip any longer. Overall better than the regular wooden mouse trap. Which I can never get to clip right and being paranoid of accidentally snapping my fingers off.
customer_reviews.author: Rosalie

customer_reviews.title: Safe to handle and set up
customer_reviews.text: I bought these traps based upon the reviews that I read on Amazon. I am extremely pleased; they did their job very well. Very clean. I used peanut butter in the Trap. As far as clean up, I put on disposable gloves, and literally held the Trap over a trash bag. I squeezed the lever and the deceased Mouse fell into the bag; I didn't even have to look at it. I totally disinfected my two traps and set them up again hoping I don't have any more Little Critters. I would highly recommend purchasing this Jawz trap.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Marie

customer_reviews.title: The most humane besides the Havahart traps
customer_reviews.text: I lived in an attic in NYC and tried the HavAHart traps, but city mice are damn clever. I didn't want to kill any of the mice, but soon I had an infestation and had no choice. The exterminators would have put out glue traps, which are horrific, or poison, which is insane, because it's a slow, painful death and then you have dead mice decomposing in your walls. It was easy to set up -- smear peanut butter in the compartment, push the lever down until you hear a click and that's all there is to it. The poor little guys were killed instantly. If the Havahart traps don't work for you, this is an alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Jenni G

customer_reviews.title: This Pair Does Not Work!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this brand of traps before without any issues so I was happy to see them on Amazon so I could replace the one my wife drove over with the car. However, both traps, while easy to set, will not snap shut when the trigger mechanism is tripped. They can be snapped if forcefully dropped or smacked on the counter, but neither trap will work when the normal trigger point is touched. Not worth the money to return for refund so they will go in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Toddly

customer_reviews.title: Mom of 2 beautiful daughters
customer_reviews.text: Got two in a pack I broke one of them setting it for it to sit out to catch a mouse and then it finally snapped after about 3 1/2 weeks and at least 200 catches of the mouse.But I do have to tell you if I would reach and grab a mouse trap and they would even be a dead mouse on it I would run to this house screaming for a good 68 minutes it freaked me out so bad
customer_reviews.author: CarrieBrown

customer_reviews.title: good for the price!!!
customer_reviews.text: at first I was kind of skeptical about these traps... but after setting them up and correctly getting the peanut butter into the bait cup (so the suckers wouldnt grab and go) It worked!!! very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Sheila M!

customer_reviews.title: The best trap I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: This mouse trap is great!!! Got 2 in one night!! The older style traps where set up also and they got 0. I very seldom wright reviews, but this product is so good at at catching mice I had to.
customer_reviews.author: John Ulinski

customer_reviews.title: These traps work!
customer_reviews.text: Tried several weeks using the victor wooden traps to catch what I thought was a genius mouse. It would lick the bait clean and the trap would not go off. After feeding it and watching it get bigger and heavier from all the goodies it was eating, I decided to purchase the JT Eaton 409 Jawz trap. 2nd night of use, whammy, permanently went to sleep. Good design, mouse has to step on a trigger plate to get to the bait bowl. Little honey with oats, deadly combo with this mouse trap!
customer_reviews.author: DW Jr

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great price!!!
customer_reviews.text: I saw a mouse in my garage & these traps caught it the next day!!! I like the ease of disposal & that they are so easy to use. Definitely a better mousetrap!!! What's not to love?
customer_reviews.author: SKY

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: a little pricey and i have had mice chew threw them. however they work better than the old style wood one. down side would be they capture mice and cripple but not kill.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Best I've ever found
customer_reviews.text: These are a little bigger and wider and seem to always get the mouse for others miss that I have. Update I have bought 6 now and so far the best I have ever used. If it's triggered it has the mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Zzzz

customer_reviews.title: Arrived quickly, works efficiently, and is easy to clean.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly, works efficiently, and is easy to clean. The mouse isn't always caught by the head which means a quick death. Sometimes it can be caught by a leg and because the trap is plastic, can chew itself free and in the process, damage the trap.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Cayne

customer_reviews.title: Interesting trap
customer_reviews.text: With any different design there are pros and cons to this trap PROS: 1. Easy to load with a good sized bait compartment 2. Easy and safe to set 3. Easy to open and dump the mouse without touching anything associated with the mouse. CONS" 1. Not sure if this looks intimidating to mice my bale traps set in same area attract more mice. But not significantly. 2. The trap release lever is just a wee bit large and some mice ( a few) set off the trap before they are fully in thus catching them by the leg. Overall a pretty efficient trap, easy, safe to set and use and I really like the bait well.
customer_reviews.author: Nyfiken

customer_reviews.title: Best Traps I've Ever Used
customer_reviews.text: I was having my bait taken with the other traps I bought. They were too big for the medium size mice in my home. I had to put tape over half the trigger hole over bait & they broke quickly. These Eaton 409's are perfect. 3 kills in several hours without the bait being touched. Very easy to set. The trigger is very sensitive. They are made well & should last a long time. 5 bucks for 2 traps is a fantastic price. I'm going to buy more. These are much better than wooden traps or the other jaw type traps I've used. No comparison, actually. Highly recommended!! -Joe
customer_reviews.author: Joe Joe Gadget

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what to say. I placed this trap one evening and by the next evening it had caught the mouse. Fairly easy to setup, put a little bait in the cup (I used peanut butter) pull up on the tab to set the trap and place it. After you catch the mouse you can either toss in trash or pull up on tab and discard the mouse and reuse as I did.
customer_reviews.author: Tim L.

customer_reviews.title: It works as described
customer_reviews.text: We had a mouse that we could hear running around on a drop ceiling. tried using the regular mouse traps for over a week. The little bastard would take the bait, sometimes setting off the trap and sometimes not. We bought these after a recommendation from a friend. By the next morning the mouse was history.
customer_reviews.author: Andy T

customer_reviews.title: Weak Traps
customer_reviews.text: When I first opened this product I wasn’t super impressed with its closing strength, but decided to give it a shot. I bought this product to catch a 2” long mouse plauguing my chicken coop. I check the traps every morning and they’re sprung and moved from their original location, but the mouse has been able to get out. I don’t recommend this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Tara Linville

customer_reviews.title: Killed two "birds" with one stone!
customer_reviews.text: Pro's - Safe enough for wife to set - Very effective (see photo) - Relatively inexpensive Con's - Plastic MAY weaken over time I bought more and will buy more if needed. We've gotten more mice with these than any other design. The ease of setting these traps may be partly responsible for this.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Samuels

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup, but I doubt they work...
customer_reviews.text: I have not caught a single mouse with this trap, which kind of defeats the purpose. But maybe the traps are so intimidating that all the mice in my house decided to vacate after I placed these around my kitchen? In any case I'm leaving two stars because I do think these are incredibly easy to setup and are much safer than conventional traps.
customer_reviews.author: Frisco

customer_reviews.title: Got em!
customer_reviews.text: For 2 weeks of no success with other traps these things are the best. They ate the peanut butter off the wood snap traps which annoyed me to no end. Tricky to place in the bottom of the oven as the traps kept going off, after several attempts my boyfriend successfully closed the oven drawer. We left the eaton trap and glue for the mouse overnight. By the morning we trapped the mouse. Awaiting the other mouses to catch in there. Also sealed the holes around all the plumbing and radiators. I live in the city and unfortunately when there is always construction these things come around, especially during winter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Chipmunks aren't as stupid as I would hope.
customer_reviews.text: The traps are easy to set, easy to empty and held up just fine to repeated use. I killed dozens of chipmunks before the @#$% damn beasties figured out how to trip the snap without getting whacked. Not poisoning the eco-chain matters to me so I'm going to give these a rest for awhile and see if the critters forget their hard-learned lesson.
customer_reviews.author: Mjolnir

customer_reviews.title: Most effective i’ve found
customer_reviews.text: Very effective. Animals don’t suffer. Easy to dump carcass in trash. A little peanut butter in the bait column and you’re good to go.
customer_reviews.author: BigMikeBoston

customer_reviews.title: A great mouse trap
customer_reviews.text: A bit difficult to set. No doubt they do a great job of catching. Mice did not get away, they were caught and dead.
customer_reviews.author: Waldeckers

customer_reviews.title: this is awesome!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: i love my apartment because its cheap but ive been visited by mice constantly and i bought all sorts of repellent sprays the device that you plug and it repels mice and the poison and the glue AND they all suck !!! they did not do a thing!!! they made my apartment more dirtier and smelly and honestly i bout this and i placed them at first in many areas with mice activities and for the first 3 days it did nothing and i had 10 of them but finally today i heard a snap and it finally caught the mice that was partying in my kitchen !!!!
customer_reviews.author: wajd

customer_reviews.title: Beware!
customer_reviews.text: Completely worthless. I bought two last year and those work perfectly even today! Bought two new ones this year and they broke just testing them! One still functions but 4 of the spikes broke off the first time it snapped. The second one is worthless, the tray trap snapped so it doesn't go off. Do not buy, they're not made like they use to be!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonJunkie

customer_reviews.title: Marginally effective
customer_reviews.text: So far the traps have been a bit unimpressive. Round one: two different traps in two separate locations had the bait taken without triggering the trap. Round two: the trap barely caught a mouse by the foot and the mouse was able to leave the area with the trap. I found it after searching my entire garage and was able to kill the mouse with BB gun. Round 3: one mouse caught & killed cleanly. Round 4: another mouse caught by the leg. Summary: 1 kill, 2 bait robs, 2 caught alive. I like the construction of the trap, but so far it's been marginally effective.
customer_reviews.author: Richard R

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Use 2 of these in my garage at all times. Catches the rascals that like to get in and eat my bird seed.
customer_reviews.author: LP

customer_reviews.title: They're supposed to be as easy to set as just clicking them open
customer_reviews.text: I read about a gazillion reviews before I decided on these things. I ordered...I think three packages, so 6 total traps. They're supposed to be as easy to set as just clicking them open. Of the 6 I got, ONE worked out of the package. The rest all required a LOT of fiddling to get them to stay open, the little latch inside just wouldn't grip the ledge and keep them open. I still have one that won't work no matter what. They are strong, but I'm entirely unimpressed.
customer_reviews.author: TechDadInTheWoods

customer_reviews.title: A Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work better than the old fashioned wood traps. The jaws are wider and it's easier to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Twain, Mark

customer_reviews.title: Jawz mouse traps, work well.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these JT Eaton 409 Jawz Easy To Set Plastic Mouse Traps after some other brand traps stopped working. I set these traps, and I caught three mice out of four traps. They are easy to set, and effective. I use a very old jar of crunchy peanut butter, pressed down hard into the bait cup with an old butter knife so that the mice can't just lift the bait out. I have bought some more traps and have placed them in strategic places. The traps also worked for several chipmunks who thought they might move into our enclosed porch.
customer_reviews.author: Forest7

customer_reviews.title: More Deadly than the Shark in "JAWS".
customer_reviews.text: Just baited my 4th little Jawz trap and an 3 for 3 kills on the first 3 . Just ordered a couple more. Have used different brands.... Don't bother - get these baby Jaws traps. If you have bigger critters to eliminate... Get the bigger Jaws trap and really watch your fingers.
customer_reviews.author: freddysrevng

customer_reviews.title: Very Easy and Effective
customer_reviews.text: It's easy to place the bait, set the trap and release the mouse after you catch one. It makes a loud snap when you catch a mouse. It's easy to check the traps because the top is red when it is set and green when it is not set. The traps are very effective; you usually do not get a runaway mouse if it is triggered. Peanut butter works well as a bait. I place traps behind the fridge and corners where the pets can't reach or they will get a scary surprise.
customer_reviews.author: StacyW

customer_reviews.title: Best trap
customer_reviews.text: These are the easiest traps I’ve ever used! They work great, too! Love these !
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: They Didn't Build a Better Trap
customer_reviews.text: These break after one catch and must be thrown away. I switched to the white model brand with the same construction that doesn't break. The quality isn't here.
customer_reviews.author: don't you wish you knew

customer_reviews.title: They work great.
customer_reviews.text: These babies work. They do have two holes for screws if you want to mount them on a small board, which is a good idea. A small bit of peanut butter in the bait holder works like a charm. Trigger system is the best out there.
customer_reviews.author: Ivana Notyers

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy until design is changed
customer_reviews.text: These used to be awsome. New design on my last purchase and it is horrible, very frustrating when it takes ten time to finally get the trap set. It actuates very easily sometimes, other times mice get the bait and runoff without it ever actuating. I dont think I've trapped a mouse in this new design yet. Two stars because the previous design was almost flawless.
customer_reviews.author: Rui & Kim

customer_reviews.title: best ever
customer_reviews.text: these are the best mouse traps ever, easy to set, mice can't steal the bait.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Horrocks

customer_reviews.title: Best Mousetraps I've Ever Used
customer_reviews.text: Best mousetraps I've ever used. Other mousetraps are so sensitive that the latch doesn't want to catch, and/or they tend to flip their switches as soon as you try to delicately place them on the floor. These are very easy to set, don't flip out when placed on the floor, and have caught many mice for me.
customer_reviews.author: Ramona R.

customer_reviews.title: Catches but not deadly. Injured mice was what I had to deal with.
customer_reviews.text: Caught 3 meeces. None were kills. Could be coincidence but all other traps killed instantly.
customer_reviews.author: OZnJerz

customer_reviews.title: Wow - really works
customer_reviews.text: I have used nothing but the humane non-kill traps for many years, but this time it seemed like a whole family of mice had moved in, and we needed something that would stop the infestation quickly. So I bought these, set them out and within 2 days we'd gotten 5 mice. It works quickly and kills them instantly. This is as humane as it gets for a trap of this kind - they don't suffer at least. It is very easy to dump the mice out and reset the trap for reuse. I am buying more.
customer_reviews.author: IS

customer_reviews.title: the JAWZ trap appears to eliminate rodent infestation without causing extended suffering to the animal
customer_reviews.text: Because the product is about as humane as any trap,I choose to purchase it. Unfortunately due to diseases spread by mice, I have to assure they are eliminated. This trap is designed to quickly do so without apparent extended suffering .I have purchased other traps which do not do so. These are priced reasonably and can be reused. One caution..watch your hands, they are very sharp and easily sprung. I use a pair of channel locks to open and close.
customer_reviews.author: Lynxwoman

customer_reviews.title: Far and away the best mouse trap I've ever seen.
customer_reviews.text: Setting it is a snap...oh well...yes, a snap. No other trap I've ever used and there are plenty, even comes close to this one for effectiveness and ease of use. This is by far the easiest to bait, with no little portholes or doors to open. Parmesan cheese seems to be the tip, but crushed cashews work great too. Just run some water over the trap after flushing and perhaps a good scrubbing with an old toothbrush and you're golden. Works like a champ and at that two-for-one pricing, how can you go wrong?
customer_reviews.author: Trapdoor33

customer_reviews.title: Mousetrap 2.0
customer_reviews.text: It isn't easy to see, but this mousetrap takes the traditional mousetrap design: a bar acting as a hammer and a trigger pedal. But it's redesigned so that it's easy to set (no worry about snapping your own fingers), harder for mice to trick, and probably more powerful. The secret is that the bait does not go on the trigger pedal, but is underneath in a hole. It would be much harder for the mouse to lick food off the trap without getting caught. I tried traditional traps and failed about four times, but these traps have a much higher success rate.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: JT Eaton 409 Jawz
customer_reviews.text: Great product, a bit tough to clean but never misses
customer_reviews.author: Bryceing

customer_reviews.title: They are made of plastic and that doesn't take lots of use easily. The traps are easy to bait and set
customer_reviews.text: These have a limit to how much use you can get out of them. They are made of plastic and that doesn't take lots of use easily. The traps are easy to bait and set. What ends up happening after awhile the plastic begins to stick or gets damaged and wont spring the trap. In a months time I think I caught about 20 mice between the two traps.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Lee Ann

customer_reviews.title: not good
customer_reviews.text: one broke first use the other shortly after i tossed them in the garbage were they belong
customer_reviews.author: Dawson

customer_reviews.title: these things are great but if peanut butter doesn't work then try marshmallow ...
customer_reviews.text: these things are great but if peanut butter doesn't work then try marshmallow creme. Little buggers can eat the PB right off the trap, but the marshmallow sticks and they get GONE.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kessler

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Set
customer_reviews.text: These traps are easy to set and work well. Mice and voles beware!
customer_reviews.author: D. Patton

customer_reviews.title: GOOD PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: I live on a farm and we seem to get a lot of mice seaking a heat source and food in winter. A neighbor let me use one and first hour one was caught so I bought 6 of them. They are super easy to set. They are made of heavy duty plastic and are easy to clean. I noticed somewhere when searching for these that the manufactor was discontinuing.......hope not, since these work great!
customer_reviews.author: CE

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work.
customer_reviews.text: Did not work at all. It kept being set off and not catching anything.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Highly reconmend this trap
customer_reviews.text: I these are one of the best traps i have ever used , i have caught 6 mice with one trap and still working since its reusable ,its very powerful that its goes flying when traps a mouse .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Self destructing mouse trap
customer_reviews.text: I have 6 of these. After a year, 4/6 have self destructed. By that, I mean the plastic will yield over time, and eventually break around the hinge spontaneously. Be prepared to to hear a loud noise and then find plastic bits scattered all around your house.
customer_reviews.author: Tone Loco

customer_reviews.title: Yes they work
customer_reviews.text: I got three mice in one day! Not something that makes me particularly happy but if you have to, you have to. And they're certainly more humane then those sticky glue traps and mouse poison. The mice were driving me crazy and spreading disease and dirt and the building exterminator brought in these mouse traps. I had never seen them. They are far and away better than any of the others. Very easy to set without putting your fingers in danger. Highly recommended. I bought some extra from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Shusu

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use. Works. Durable
customer_reviews.text: These are easier to use than the wooden ones and catch mice.
customer_reviews.author: T. Needham

customer_reviews.title: unfortunately,  they didn't work.
customer_reviews.text: I'm sorry, but it didn't work for me. Maybe the mouse is too smart for it.
customer_reviews.author: Darling Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Better options!
customer_reviews.text: Used these traps and the first night they went off but did not catch a mouse. The second night, I added four tomcat brand traps to these traps. All four tomcat traps "caught" mice, but these did not....one of the JAWS traps actually disappeared ( I am assuming dragged away by a mouse). Would not recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: shopalotTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: These traps are great! Much more user friendly than the old school cheese traps. One problem, sometimes the mechanism to keep them open doesn't work on the first try you may have to open and close a few times to get the trap to work.
customer_reviews.author: Rmaciejewski

customer_reviews.title: Best Mice Trap ever made
customer_reviews.text: Best Mice Trap ever made!!! I had got some of these a couple of years ago one trap has caught 13 mice so far and still works I use it in the garage and shed does the job better then any other trap I have used so far it always kills the mice and is easy to re bait and reuse.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: 100 + kills and counting
customer_reviews.text: that's right--- i have killed at least 100 mice with 2 of these traps and neither one has broken. i live on 5 acres and mice can be a problem in the house if not kept in check outside. i only use one trap at a time, placed under the edge of my deck and check it each morning. works great, is easy to set, and has lasted a year or more. i mounted it to a scrap piece of wood so it doesen't get dragged under the deck.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Better Mouse Trap
customer_reviews.text: Ever heard the expression "building a better mouse trap"? There is no need after these guys! Totally re-useable and much more reliable than the old wooden ones (although those work great as well). I have never found one of these sprung and left empty. (BTW - A dab of peanut butter is deadly in these things!)
customer_reviews.author: MaasMan

customer_reviews.title: This is not bad, it's WORTHLESS!
customer_reviews.text: Total waste of time and money! You would have just as good of results if you made a tiny little lasso and tried to catch them with it!
customer_reviews.author: blessed guy

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 10 of these because I have yet to find a trap that works the way it says it will work. So far, half the traps did not work out of the package so I basically just made a donation to the company. The ones that were able to be used did work but I am moving on to try something else knowing that if I buy these again, I am taking a chance of another donation.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle L. Duprey

customer_reviews.title: Best trap
customer_reviews.text: These are the very best traps. I have tried all the others and the little buggers can usually end up either escaping from them, or they crawl off to places unknown and you never find the mouse or your expensive traps. But with JAWZ it is a different story. It is more sensitive and they do not have the chance to get away! You can release them too without touching.
customer_reviews.author: PrecioustoHim

customer_reviews.title: fairly reliable trap with strong jaws
customer_reviews.text: if trap was tripped, then had a mouse-----placement of the bait did allow some removal of the bait without tripping to occur though; perhaps i need to develop better baiting technique on my part; fortunately, did not have that large of a mouse problem to practice on
customer_reviews.author: frugal german

customer_reviews.title: Does not work.
customer_reviews.text: This product does not work. I placed peanut butter in the little cup and the next day the peanut butter was gone and trap still set - no mouse. This happened with all 4 traps. They do not work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It’s trash don’t bother
customer_reviews.text: Trash.. the mouse just eat from it twice now and the trap never went off.
customer_reviews.author: Antwizl

customer_reviews.title: Very effective!
customer_reviews.text: These traps are really effective! We were having moderate success with the old Victor wooden snap traps, but often had to rebait them. Also, didn't want to reuse those. These traps are easy - put some peanut butter in the hole, click the trap back, set against the wall. Caught 3 mice in 24 hours! Easy to dump the mouse out and reset the trap, didn't even have to rebait. Highly recommend these traps!
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Jahn

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I have caught several mice so far with this trap so it must be working ok.
customer_reviews.author: JayG

customer_reviews.title: It works..
customer_reviews.text: I got 2 mice out of two trap and reuse them both, but the third one got away. It looked like it gnawed itself out since there looked like a bloodbath where the trap was so I had to throw the bloody trap away. The second trap I, too, had to throw away since the snap system is too sensitive, I cannot bend it back anymore because it kept snapping back. For the price I paid, it was well-worth it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Don't work
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy, peanut butter was gone & trap didn't go off!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product. Durable and reliable
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Durable and reliable. Keeps you from having to come in direct contact with the deceased rodent.
customer_reviews.author: cc

customer_reviews.title: Rat escapes
customer_reviews.text: Good quality product with strong and quick spring action but still the rat escapes from the jaw.
customer_reviews.author: Deepa

customer_reviews.title: I bought the Intruder 30442 The Better Mousetrap 6 pack and have caught five mice in ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had no luck with these traps. I bought the Intruder 30442 The Better Mousetrap 6 pack and have caught five mice in two days. I had the Jawz mouse traps out for three days and they ate the peanut butter and left full but perfectly alive. They do not appear sensitive enough to catch smaller mice.
customer_reviews.author: EmilyH

customer_reviews.title: 1/2 works
customer_reviews.text: 1 of the 2 traps broke after first use. 2nd onr seems to be working okay.
customer_reviews.author: Drogpa

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: very effective. I use snickers for bait and it is perfect
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: SNAP!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: KILLS THE MOUSE AS SOON AS IT SNAPS. I EVEN HAD A MOUSE THAT GOT IT GUTS KNOCKED OUT FROM THE FORCE OF THESE TRAPS. WELL WORTH THE MONEY AND YOU WILL NEVER HAVE TOO TOUCH THE SNAPPING DEVICE AGIAN, LIKE THE OLD WOODEN ONES. DO NOT LISTEN TO THE COMPLAINERS THESE ARE THE ONLY TRAPS YOUR EVER NEED TO KILL THESE LITTLE PEST.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Combs

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: These work great and are easy to set and even easier to release what you catch.
customer_reviews.author: Orangejbird

customer_reviews.title: Work great, easy to set
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these traps for about a week now and they are great!! They're SO much easier (and safer) to set than the traditional wood & wire traps. They're also very effective - they worked the very first night I put them down, and have worked a few times since. Only once did one of them get the bait stolen without flipping. I plan on buying another pair soon.
customer_reviews.author: Obbie1

customer_reviews.title: Great traps!
customer_reviews.text: Bottom line up front: Strong springs that deliver quick kills and are easy and safe to use. I placed ten of these traps around my home and yard this afternoon and got two clean kills in about an hour. I was using the Tomcat traps but they left way too many wounded mice for me to finish off. The JT Eaton 409 traps have strong springs and deliver killing blows. The mice don't know what hit them. It's very simple to dispose of the bodies and reset/reuse the traps. I can also confirm that mice can't resist peanut butter...even the low fat type my wife insists we must eat.
customer_reviews.author: Brett1098S

customer_reviews.title: Best snap trap available
customer_reviews.text: I've tried quite a few brands and this seems to be the one that really does the job. Its a really good mousetrap. Its big and lethal - nothing more depressing than a half dead mouse after all. Its easy to load and set and later to empty and so far I've never had it snap without catching a mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Tristan Yates

customer_reviews.title: It worked!
customer_reviews.text: Caught the little mouse haunting our home! Tried a few different brands and the sticky boxes, but only this one worked! It was placed under a sofa with peanuts as bait. Easy and safe to set up. Just keep it out of reach from kids. My curious 2 year old was caught also!
customer_reviews.author: bluemanta

customer_reviews.title: I reccomend these traps
customer_reviews.text: These are the best traps I have ever used. I like that they are reusable. I just put a bit of peanut butter on and set it. It works every time.
customer_reviews.author: SonoMom

customer_reviews.title: Easy release! Get them!!
customer_reviews.text: Can't go wrong with these. Its a push back and click. To set you push back the green part then red shows so you know it's set. Soooo easy to get rid of the mouse without touching where they were snapped or being worried about getting snapped yourself with the old wood wire mouse traps when you're setting it. Don't be worried that the plastic won't catch them. I've had these for years and they're completely reliable. Use peanut butter - catches more.
customer_reviews.author: LMS

customer_reviews.title: Best Mousetraps at Great Price
customer_reviews.text: We only use Jawz now. They are simply the best, and Amazon has the best price.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Harry

customer_reviews.title: Still no better mousetrap
customer_reviews.text: These are nice mouse traps but they really don't work any better than my cheap old wooden and metal ones. In fact they seem to be a little less sensitive than my old school ones. While they are definitely easier to set than the traditional ones, I really don't think it's worth the extra money and potential loss in sensitivity.
customer_reviews.author: Adam T. Tremper

customer_reviews.title: Really great first time you use
customer_reviews.text: Really great first time you use. Says it is reusable, but think it should only reuse once since lock mechanism very spotty with continued use.
customer_reviews.author: msburnsy

customer_reviews.title: Not even any hair around the trap so its not like it loosened/wiggled it's way out
customer_reviews.text: Set both traps out last night in separate areas. Both engaged. Caught nothing. Not sure if the spring/power is too weak or too slow. Not even any hair around the trap so its not like it loosened/wiggled it's way out. Will try again tonight.
customer_reviews.author: John Kim

customer_reviews.title: Works better than a cat in the house
customer_reviews.text: These are the best mouse traps I have ever used. Super simple to set. Have caught a whole extended family of mice. Once saw a mouse eating out of my cat's food dish one night. Lazy feline had one job. Set out one of these overnight, and by morning, we got the smug bastard (or at least one of his friends). I have used a multitude of different traps, from electrical current traps, to the spin traps, to glue. These are easily the most effective.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Meier

customer_reviews.title: Simple and reusable
customer_reviews.text: These are great because they are reusable and quick and easy to dispose the “victim”. You barely even have to see what got caught...which is a big plus to my eyes!!
customer_reviews.author: Heidi W.

customer_reviews.title: Expensive if you can only use once.
customer_reviews.text: The traps work well but I have not been able to reset most of them a second time. Also they snap shut when I am trying to place them. If anyone knows why I have this problem help would be appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Joan

customer_reviews.title: 50% fail rate
customer_reviews.text: I guess one out of two ain't bad, doh!. One would just not latch open, when it finally did, it then snapped shut and the trap broke in half. It'd recommend the snap e or the old school wood victor traps, I've had those snap shut without breaking.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Baker

customer_reviews.title: easy to set
customer_reviews.text: these are awesome! easy to set and easy to dump! I got extra for my mom and my husband and others that have difficulty setting the old wooden spring loaded traps. these are extremely easy, even for someone with arthritis, or not so good reflexes.. my family has caught many mice with these
customer_reviews.author: LDA

customer_reviews.title: GOOD BECAUSE IT'S EASY TO SEE IN DARK AREA
customer_reviews.text: These traps worked well. I like them better than another brand I bought at the same time despite the fact they both work the same way. But with this brand, I can glance down from a distance to where I put it in not well lighted areas and see why the color coding whether it has snapped a mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Novak

customer_reviews.title: Good trap?
customer_reviews.text: A way to rid your house of the pests. Easy to set and when the pest is caught, do not have to touch it. Easy removal and set the trap again. One of the traps will not lock. One works perfectly and the other will not work(lock or load) properly.
customer_reviews.author: stacey

customer_reviews.title: Best mouse trap ever
customer_reviews.text: These mouse traps worked well. I baited them with raw bacon. They are easy to set, and did the job. While technically they are reusable, that is too icky a proposition for me. When a mouse was caught I put on rubber gloves and threw away the trap with the dead mouse... and the gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Seamist

product_meta.title: JT Eaton 409 Jawz Plastic Mouse Trap for Solid or Liquid Bait, 2-Pack
product_meta.description: The JT Eaton 409 Jawz Plastic Mouse Trap is a popular method for pest removal and features a high tension spring to eliminate mice and other small pests. Each trap is easy and safe to set compared to traditional wooden traps and can be set by hand or foot. When the trap is properly set, the red label faces upward to indicate it's ready to go. This makes it incredibly simple to set multiple traps and reduces false alarms. Made of durable plastic, these traps are smaller than multi catch traps for discreet placement underneath furniture and other tight spaces and are fully reusable. This snap trap works best with liquid or solid bait and comes in a 2-pack. The JT Eaton 409 Jawz Plastic Mouse Trap comes with a 1-year limited warranty to protect against defects in material and workmanship. JT Eaton’s mission is to manufacture and distribute products designed to eradicate pests. We continually seek out new ways to provide consumers with the knowledge and products they need to create a healthier and safer world. JT Eaton has been family owned and operated since 1932 and they manufacture and sell only the highest quality products.
feature_bullets: Features a high tension spring to eliminate mice and other small pests
Set by hand or foot with a red label to indicate if the trap is properly set
Works best with liquid or solid bait and comes in a 2-pack
Made of durable plastic and small size for discreet placement underneath equipment and in tight spaces

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
